meanings.definition: Two individuals united in some way
meanings.sent1: A couple of friends went to the park together.
meanings.sent2: I saw a couple walking hand in hand down the street.
meanings.sent3: The couple shared a big slice of cake at the party.
meanings.sent4: Their love was like a couple of puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The elderly couple sat on the bench, reminiscing about their youth.

meanings.sent1: I only need a couple of minutes to finish this task.
meanings.sent2: She grabbed a couple of apples from the fruit bowl.
meanings.sent3: The kids found a couple of seashells on the beach.
meanings.sent4: A couple of stars twinkled in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: He bought a couple of books at the bookstore.

meanings.definition: To join together or connect in some way
meanings.sent1: I will couple the two wires to complete the circuit.
meanings.sent2: The train cars will couple together before departing.
meanings.sent3: The magician will couple the rings in his next trick.
meanings.sent4: The ideas in the essay couple seamlessly to form a strong argument.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces couple easily to reveal the picture.
